skill.name: Backend Models
skill.description: Define and configure database models with proper naming, relationships, timestamps, data types, constraints, and validation. Use this skill when creating or editing model files in app/Models/, Eloquent model classes, model relationships (hasMany, belongsTo, etc.), database table structures, model attributes and casts, model factories, or seeders. Use when working on model validation logic, database constraints, foreign key relationships, indexes, scopes, accessors, mutators, or any ORM-related model configuration.

It contains no executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond reading documentation files. content.user_title: Create Laravel Models with Best Practices
content.value_statement: Building Laravel models correctly ensures data integrity and performance. This skill provides expert guidance on Eloquent model conventions, relationships, and validation patterns.
actual_capabilities: Guides creation of Eloquent models with proper naming conventions
Recommends model validation and casting best practices
Explains when to use factories, seeders, and model events
limitations: Only applies to Laravel framework applications
Does not generate actual model code automatically

output_examples.input: Create a Post model with user relationship and slug generation
output: Adds belongsTo relationship to User model
Implements slug generation in boot method

best_practices: Always use proper relationship methods with return type hints
Configure casts() method instead of $casts property in Laravel 12
Create factories alongside new models for testing
anti_patterns: Avoid using DB::raw() queries when Eloquent relationships can be used
Don't skip relationship type hints - they prevent bugs
Never use env() directly in models - use config() instead

faq.question: Which Laravel versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports Laravel 12 with PHP 8.4, including the latest Eloquent features and conventions

faq.question: Can this skill generate actual model files?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance and best practices. Use Laravel's artisan make:model command to generate files

faq.question: Does it work with other PHP frameworks?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed for Laravel's Eloquent ORM and won't apply to other frameworks

faq.question: How do I handle model relationships?
faq.answer: The skill provides specific guidance on hasMany, belongsTo, belongsToMany, and polymorphic relationships

faq.question: What about model testing?
faq.answer: The skill explains how to create factories and use Pest for testing your models effectively

faq.question: Can I use this with existing models?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill helps refactor and improve existing models to follow Laravel best practices
